problem_text:
21.104. For a group word w(x1, . . . , xn) on n letters, define e0(x1, . . . , xn) = x1 and
ek+1(x1, . . . , xn) = w(ek(x1, . . . , xn), . . . , xn) for all k ∈N.
A group G is said to
satisfy the Engel type iterated identity w if for all x1, . . . , xn ∈G there exists m ∈N
such that em(x1, . . . , xn) = 1.
Conjecture: For every non-trivial word w, if a finitely generated branch group G
(see 15.12) satisfies the iterated identity w, then G is a torsion group.
This is true in the case of the commutator word w = [x1, x2] (G. Fern´andez-
Alcober, M. Noce, G. Tracey, J. Algebra, 554 (2020), 54–77).
M. Petschick
